channel.title: Nothing. . . Works. . . On. . . MAC!
channel.description:
Well now I’ve been checking out private servers for about two months now and Im pretty sure that any day now Im gonna lose my mind. You see I have a Mac and soon after buying it I realized that nobody feels mac is important enough to make anything for but anyway, even the things that are supposed to work for mac don’t work. I’ve checked out 1. Battlescape 2. Moparscape 3. SiggiScape 4. Mac - Scape
After trying different, already made servers, I tried making them. One problem I ran into was all the compilers were batch files and mac gets confused with those. So heres what I’m asking: is there anyway somebody could find some awesome server (webclient hopefully) that actually works for mac or help me make an awesome server that does.BTW, Im looking for a server with particular emphasis on gaining levels quickly.

item.title: Nothing. . . Works. . . On. . . MAC!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

You shouldn’t have bought Mac… I personally like Macs though. To backup what zyle1992 said, they even come with Apache Ant preinstalled.

Read full topic

item.title: Nothing. . . Works. . . On. . . MAC!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“blood beast, post:3, topic:392742”]Well I followed the links and eventual wound up at Emps-scape. Unfortunately, that server did the same as all the rest so we can scratch that one off the list.
Anybody know if making a script would be easier than finding one that is compatible with mac?[/quote]

You sir, are an idiot.

  1. Batch files are windows specific.
  2. Java is cross platform. Most Macs come with Java shipped.
  3. All you need to do, is open Terminal, cd to the directory where your server files are, then java path/to/main/class

Read full topic
